Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to explore coping strategies for stress, particularly related to work pressures and deadlines.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient discusses feelings of being overwhelmed by work deadlines and the pressure to produce quality work quickly. They also mention feeling less guilty about family time due to dedicated art time, which has helped them feel more fulfilled.
Current Functional Status: The patient reports sticking to their art schedule, completing a piece, and enjoying family activities, indicating a positive engagement in personal and family life.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels good about the strategies discussed and acknowledges their progress in managing stress and reconnecting with themselves through art.
Therapeutic Interventions: Strategies discussed include breaking tasks into smaller parts and incorporating mindfulness breaks during work to manage stress.
Next Steps: The patient plans to implement mindfulness breaks and check in on their progress in the next session.
